features: 1.5V ARGB SYNC:Built with the advanced ARGB lighting system,support 5V 3PIN ARGB motherboard synchronization, multiple rgb modes can be switched,makes your computer case colorful.
2. Perfect Cooling Performance:Tuned for high-airflow, large volume cooling, silent operation as an excellent choice for case cooling.
3. Anti-vibration design:Equipped with 8 anti-vibration rubber pads to effectively prevent vibration during operation, greatly reducing noise and improving efficiency.
4.High Quality: Equipped with wear-resistant hydraulic bearing technology for quieter operation, more stability and long life.
5. Two Way Installation:Easy for installation.You can either blow warm air out of the case or draw cool air into your case.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Enhanced frame structure: Enhanced frame structure, reducing turbulence and noise while increasing overall efficiency. Create a symphony of color: Lighting With 8 ultra-bright RGB LED lights, provides full lighting for your build, achieving magical lighting effects with multiple-choice controls and multiple different modes of breathing, static, and multi-color cycling. Optimized fan design: We have further optimize the design of the fan blades to provide more airflow with less noise. This high air pressure and extremely efficient ventilation for your gaming case.

High Quality Bearing： Hydraulic bearing design effectively prolongs the service life, improves the heat dissipation efficiency, strengthens the air exchange cooling system, and reduces the noise. 5V ARGB SYNC: Support the synchronization function of the 5V ARGB motherboard.Compatible with motherboard software includes US aura Sync, Gigabyte RGB FUSION, MSI Mystic Light Sync, etc. PWM Smart Control: PWM function allows the motherboard to run the fan precisely at its necessary speed.

TIPS Motherboard with an open standard 4-pin fan connector and 5V RGB connector. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2022
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. edit: bought a second one so I could use 10 fans , held down the reset button so they hsed my motherboard and…now ai have to do that every time. It wasnt like this with my first set/hub, how annoying. The reset switch doesnt work with the older hub either so i cant reset them both.Very nice and pretty. Easy to install, hub is kinda chunky tho, and the adhesive doesnt always stay stuck in my case. Also when I have rgb color on, at one point in the spiral it looks like red disappears. (Seen in video) Doesnt bother me tho!!!Very nice woosh sound, not a buzzing fan sound. Case is kept very cool and they dont attract much dust.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Never let me down
reviews.reviewText: I have a small side biz of building PC's to sell and have ordered 7 sets of these fans for my budget builds. Almost 2 years in and I have yet to have or hear of a fan dying so I will continue to use these fan kits. Cheap way to add some aRGB to your rigs while keeping them quiet and cool

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great value for RGB fans.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered these fans because I have a 120mm Uphere liquid CPU cooler. These fans do match up well, but I liked them so much I am using them on another build. I am extremely sick and tired of RGB. I cringe every time I see another rainbow technicolor mess. But I do like the ability to change colors to suit my mood. Implementation is key.The fans push alot of air, and the blades are oriented to provide decent static pressure. They include rubber grommets for the corner mounts to reduce vibration. Also there is a decent fan/LED control module, but this thing takes up quite a bit of space. However with this many cables, a hub is a necessity.As far as aesthetics go, they look good if not terribly amazing. The fan hubs are large, which is where the LEDs shine outward. Not my favorite orientation, but it is diffused well with low translucence frosted blades. the color accuracy is above average, with a white color that is not blueish at all. Most RGB devices have a hard time with yellow/orange and the boxed controller is no exception. The fans lent themselves well to motherboard control, both LED and fan speed.And now to the major drawback, and it is not inconsequential. Each fan has 2 cables, the 12V Fan Power and the 3 pin RGB lead. They have mitigated spaghettification by using thin and flat cables. However due to the tiny gauge wires, in my experience they can be easily pinched and broken through normal cable management. Be careful!Some other fan manufacturers have come up with ingenious designs to daisy chain multiple fans without all the wire mess. Of course those fans carry a price premium. But I believe eventually any RGB fan multipacks will include some way to minimize cables. So for now, this is a good budget option. Just be aware that many thin cables are in your future. Recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an easy install of 4/5 fans, the 5th fan I need longer fan screws to use than cane in the package. The package contained 5 fans, and new short screws, and a hub controller. The Instructions are terrible but you can figure them out if you’re familiar with motherboard setups. Just be sure not to use the 12V RBG and use the 5V one.I had other LED lights in my case and I was able to remove them and this helped on cable management as well. I went from 2 to 4 fans currently but will add the 5th one soon.This will help with the other upgrades and heat from the new GPU. I would recommend this setup at this price.Update: I got all 5 fans in the case and they are running great. The red, really matches the Red on my Red Devil GPU and makes the entire setup look menacing. The only thing I have noticed because this is all daisy chained together into a hub your bios doesn’t track but 1 can speed as only 1 fan port is used on the Motherboard. But they do a great job of helping to keep case temps down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cheap fans. You get the quality you pay for
reviews.reviewText: Fans look great, are quiet and do what they are suppose to.HOWEVER. I'm now 4 months after buying/install and one of them are dying/making a grinding sound. I have a few extra but I think it's ridiculous for them to die this quickly

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For the cost the fans work so well

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Lights Unsync from MOBO each time windows sleeps :(
reviews.reviewText: Fans operate well and they’re near silent which is great. However the argb programming is terrible. Polychrome sync works poorly with these fans. The lights unsync every time window goes to “sleep.” You have to unscrew the case to access the switch each time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just as good as more expensive fan packs
reviews.reviewText: *This is for the listing that comes with a fan controller, not the remote. The controller fans are 4 pin pwm, with seperate 3 pin 5v rgb headers, and work independently of the included controller*This was an experiment in cheapness that really paid off in my recent build. my Thermaltake watercooling kit warranted matching fans, but this thing has 13 total, so this 5 pack saved me a big chunk of cash. they push just as much air as the Thermaltake TT rgb, and are identical in illumination and fin style and color.The only con I could find, is that the controler is large, and pretty limited, but they're compatible with addressable RGB and even work fine if all are connected to one pigtail coming from a Phanteks fan controller. with everything going to a 3 pin controller, and plugged into aura sync header, they're awesome.Highly recommended if you plan on using a different fan controller for better lighting options.
